title: Group fitness classes becoming more popular with men
text:
Group fitness classes becoming more popular with men 
By Matt Lincoln/CBS12PALM BEACH GARDENS, Fla. (CBS12) - Orangetheory Fitness began as just one studio in Fort Lauderdale eight years ago.Now there are hundreds all over the world. Their popularity has a lot to do with a growing change in the world of fitness, where men are much more open to group exercise classes than ever before. The world of group exercise is changing.It's not just the equipment, clothing and exercises."Group fitness has always been a woman thing."Ellen Latham is changing that.She started "Ellen's Ultimate Workout" 8 years ago, in her pilates studio in Fort Lauderdale as a metabolic workout for her female clients. "Over four decades I had never seen people so engaged or committed. I knew I was on to something." Latham also noticed she could reach out to a new market - men. "They started taking their husbands. Then soon after just their husbands were showing up, and leaving their wives at home." Ellen's Ultimate Workout became Orangetheory and now there are 270 locations across the world in places like Australia, Mexico and Colombia. Latham estimates men make up almost 40 percent of clients. The magazine "Men's Fitness" included Orangetheory in its list of "One of the Nine Fitness Classes to Try in 2015".One reason men like the workout, is the science behind it. You wear a monitor which reads your heart rate. If you get it in the "orange level" 20 percent of your workout, you're making the most of it.Men all across the world are learning - pushing yourself to the limit, isn't as fun when you do it alone.
